meanings.definition: Capable of being overcome or surpassed.
meanings.sent1: The mountain was so overable that even the youngest hiker could reach the top.
meanings.sent2: The challenge seemed overable to the determined team.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant thought the huge sandwich was overable to conquer.
meanings.sent4: Her determination made the seemingly overable task achievable.
meanings.sent5: The overable obstacle in his path only fueled his determination to succeed.

meanings.definition: Able to be covered or crossed.
meanings.sent1: The shallow stream was overable by simply stepping over it.
meanings.sent2: The bridge made the wide river overable for the travelers.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the large box to be overable for a cozy nap.
meanings.sent4: The overable distance between the two trees was easily crossed by the agile squirrel.
meanings.sent5: The overable gap in the fence allowed the dog to escape the yard.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being discussed or debated.
meanings.sent1: The topic was overable during the class debate.
meanings.sent2: The controversial issue was overable among the group of friends.
meanings.sent3: The overable question sparked a lively discussion at the dinner table.
